description.h2: In this videogame, you are a cat exploring a world of pixels!
description.p: You can play in singleplayer or multiplayer and discover new biomes! How far can you explore?

iframe.a: Play You Are A Cat ! on itch.io

description.p: Hello! I am WebCoder49, a keen coder and web developer! I created this website and blog, webcoder49.wordpress.com, to teach you how to code the web and learn codes which let you be creative! I will also use it to showcase my projects, so you can play and enjoy them, as well as being able to see the code!

Hello! This is where you can play the games I have coded. If you want to learn how to code games like this, please go to my website or my YouTube channel where you can find tutorials on web development. I put other coding projects on repl.it and GitHub. Just follow the links to see more or play my games here, at webcoder49.itch.io!

p.b: Please start watching my videos by clicking here, or read the description below...

iframe.allow: accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture

p.p: Hello! This channel aims to teach you and show you how many different things can be made on the web, from computer games to websites and prime number programs.
To see what I've made using HTML, CSS and JavaScript (coding languages on the web), see my site below and enter the world of web development!
If you don't want to learn web development, you can have fun playing these games, but if you do want to learn it, why not learn it?

The coding languages that make up the web are very useful as they can be used to create many different programs! Web development can be your hobby in the future, or even your job if you work hard enough! Once you've started learning, you can release your creativity in code!

description.h2: View the code for some of my projects.
A python game which tests your knowledge of HEX colours...

ol.li: Open the game here and click Run.
Type how many colours you want to guess in the Python console.
Search the internet for a "HEX colour picker" and try to make it match the colour displayed in the console.
Type the HEX code (look on the colour picker - the code is something like #8f4d90) into the console. Don't type the "#"; it is already there.
Once you have guessed all the colours, look at the console for your score! How well did you do?

iframe.sandbox: allow-forms allow-pointer-lock allow-popups allow-same-origin allow-scripts allow-modals

description.p: HEX Codes are colour codes used in web development to specify specific colours in CSS for elements.

This project is a tribute to the computer scientist Alan Turing, and is a simulation of a machine in one of his thought experiments. When you are writing the algorithm, hover over a field to see what it is.

iframe.sandbox: allow-forms allow-pointer-lock allow-popups allow-same-origin allow-scripts allow-modals

p.a: Open project in a new tab
